title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
Description: First and most well known of the Clean series of Uncle Bob, a must-read on TDD

title: The Clean Coder
author: Robert C. Martin
Description: What is a good Dev, where does he fit in an organization? How should he organize his time at work? Here you'll find advice on stuff like the pomodoro technique, pair programming, and more

title: The Phoenix Project
author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, George Spafford
Description: A book about the origins of Agile and DevOps and how it took inspiration from Lean in manufacturing. Not technical at all, but too important in the history of DevOps to be skipped

title: Accelerate
author: Nicole Forsgren, Jez Humble, Gene Kim
Description: Another foundational book about DevOps from a company organization perspective, this one is based on data issued from research

title: Nand to Tetris
author: H. G. Wells
Description: Ever wondered how ones and zeroes are put together to make a computer? This is the book that will answer all your questions

title: An unbiased evaluation of environment management and packaging tools
author: Anna-Lena Popkes
Description: The ultimate overview of tooling around the Python ecosystem
